meanings.sent1: I tried to insolubilize the sugar in water by adding too much of it.
meanings.sent2: The chemist used a special chemical to insolubilize the oil in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The naughty elf tried to insolubilize the glue to play a prank on his friends.
meanings.sent4: The magician's spell seemed to insolubilize the air around him, creating a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers could insolubilize any liquid, making him invincible in battles.

meanings.definition: Render (a substance) incapable of being dissolved.
meanings.sent1: The heat will insolubilize the sugar, making it impossible to dissolve.
meanings.sent2: The strong acid can insolubilize even the toughest minerals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to insolubilize the treat in the water, thinking it would last longer.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to insolubilize the colors on the canvas, creating a unique effect.
meanings.sent5: The freezing temperature would insolubilize the liquid, turning it into solid ice.
